home.title: Ricky Martinez - Home
home.tagline: Do Not Repeat Yourself. Test with precision.
home.name: RICKY MARTINEZ
home.description: Developer and problem-solver who thrives on efficiency, creativity, and automation. From test frameworks to full-stack systems, I love building solutions that make technology work smarter, not harder.
home.aboutText1: I'm a NYC-based software engineer with a passion for building efficient, automated solutions. When I'm not coding, you'll find me exploring the city or tinkering with something new.
home.aboutText2: I have a chronic interest in developing software and optimizing workflows. Whether it's network automation, QA automation, or personal life automation, I enjoy finding patterns and creating solutions that make things easier.
home.aboutText3: Born in Queens and raised in the Bronx, I've always been curious about how things work. This curiosity led me to learn music, engineering, and eventually, software development. Now I focus on building automation tools and efficient systems—because why not be efficient?
home.aboutText4: This site itself uses automation I've developed for both backend and frontend. Check out the
home.techStackSubtitle: Technologies and tools I work with

projects.title: Projects - Ricky Martinez
projects.heading: Projects
projects.subtitle: Home to my current endeavors. What's Ricky up to?

descriptions.blue-manager: Property maintenance app with OCR and Supabase backend.
descriptions.personal-website: Personal site to host notes, tutorials, and projects — originally built as a Python teaching platform.
descriptions.xpress-transit: Ride management and scheduling app built with Django and React for handling vehicle and passenger data.
descriptions.auth: Simple Python-based authorization script that enables or restricts features based on username permissions.
descriptions.connectivity-monitor: Monitors network connectivity via ping, TCP, or UDP and alerts when endpoints become unreachable.
descriptions.cr-ip-lookup: Utility for performing IP and hostname lookups to quickly identify and cross-reference connected resources.
descriptions.error-checker: Automated script validator that scans all scripts for runtime errors and emails daily success or failure reports.
descriptions.f5-sdk: Wrapper script that uses the F5 SDK to extract and store network device configurations and metadata.
descriptions.f5-diffs: Compares F5 configuration snapshots to identify and log differences between environments or revisions.
descriptions.f5requests: Lightweight Python library for easily interacting with F5 devices over REST APIs.
descriptions.f5-vip-search: Search utility for locating and analyzing Virtual IP (VIP) configurations across multiple F5 load balancers.
descriptions.gen-graph: Python module for generating charts and graphs from structured data to embed in dashboards or web pages.
descriptions.g-photography-php: A PHP-based photo gallery and management system with enhancements over the original Python version.
descriptions.interface-err-report: Tool for parsing and reporting interface errors across network devices to assist with troubleshooting.
descriptions.intranet-site: Internal company intranet built to centralize scripts, dashboards, and documentation for quick access.
descriptions.ip-requests: Toolkit for logging and analyzing IP-based HTTP requests with metadata and reporting utilities.
descriptions.kappasigmahc: Static website and code repository for the Kappa Sigma High Council chapter, showcasing events and history.
descriptions.muscribe: Early prototype of an AI-powered tool that converts instrument audio into sheet music or note notation.
descriptions.gops: C++ prototype of a navigation system designed to process coordinates and simulate GPS-like pathing logic.

codingChallenges.title: Understanding "My" Way
codingChallenges.quote: if you can't explain it in your own words, you don't really know it.
codingChallenges.description: The following are in categories instead of "lesson" number. There will also be a little explanation/ description to explain the code/concept.

trie.title: Trie
trie.intro: Tries are very useful and are useful when implementing an autocorrect feature.
trie.example1: For exmaple, on the left we start with no letter. But then we branch of into the letters t, A, i. Let's focus on the t for now.
trie.example2: t branches off into to and te. to is its own word (for all that we know) so that's it for that specific word.
trie.explanation1: Lets understand that a bit, just in case:
trie.explanation2: te banches off into those words (child nodes) because, for all we know, those are the words that can be formulated using that te (parent node).
